text: is a Japanese Shinto shrine in Shiso, Hyōgo on the island of Honshu.Kotodamaya.com, "Iwo Jinja"; retrieved 2012-11-20. ==History== Iwa jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of the old Harima Province. It serves today as one of the ichinomiya of Hyōgo Prefecture. "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 ; retrieved 2012-11-20. This place is special to the kami named ==References== ==Other websites == Category:Kokuhei Chūsha Category:Myōjin Taisha Category:Beppyo shrines Category:Ichinomiya Category:Shinto shrines in Hyōgo Prefecture
title: Iwa Shrine
